clinical_study.brief_title: Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure in Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure in Postoperative Cardiac Surgery: A Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Prof. Dr. Antônio Marcos Vargas da Silva

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine the effects of Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure (BiPAP) on variables clinics, cardiorespiratory and physical functional in patients undergoing cardiac surgery at the University Hospital of Santa Maria.

detailed_description.textblock: This randomized controlled trial aimed to evaluate the effects of Bilevel Positive Airway Pressure (BiPAP) in patients undergoing heart surgery of valve replacement and coronary artery bypass graft on the variables clinics, cardiorespiratory and physical functional.These individuals were randomized to compose the control group (GC) and the BiPAP group (GBiPAP). The routine physical therapy was performed in both groups and in the BiPAPG two daily sessions of 20 minutes were applied with positive expiratory pressure of 10cmH2O and inspiratory of 15cmH2O. To verify the effect of this intervention, before and after the protocol patients underwent the following evaluations: the 6-minute walk test (6MWT), the heart rate variability, the manovacuometry, and cirtometry in the axillary line, umbilical line and the xiphoid appendix.

primary_outcome.measure: Peripheral Oxygen Saturation by pulse oximetry

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate variability by a pulse frequency meter
Maximum inspiratory pressure by a digital pressure transducer (manovacuometry)
Maximum expiratory pressure by a digital pressure transducer (manovacuometry)

arm_group.description: The routine physical therapy will be performed in two groups (control and BiPAP). The BiPAP group will receive two daily sessions of 20 minutes, with positive expiratory pressure of 10cmH2O and inspiratory of 15cmH2O.
Routine physical therapy will be performed.

intervention.description: Bilevel positive airway pressure twice per day during the hospital stay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized patients in preoperative for coronary artery bypass or valve replacement.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to understand or sign a free and informed consent form
- Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
- Cerebrovascular disease
- Musculoskeletal disease
- Chronic infectious disease
- Unstable angina
- Treatment with steroids, hormones or chemotherapy for cancer
- Prolonged mechanical ventilation
- Unable of maintaining airway patency
- Severe hemodynamic instability
- Abdominal distension or vomiting.
